info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Hard Freeze Warning issued October 24 at 6:19PM PDT until October 26 at 10:00AM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...HARD FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM WEDNESDAY TO 10 AM PDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures as low as 28 expected. * WHERE...Upper Hood River Valley. * WHEN...From 11 PM Wednesday to 10 AM PDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Subfreezing temperatures will kill crops and other sensitive vegetation. Unprotected outdoor plumbing may be damaged by the cold temperatures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures are expected to become even colder Thursday night through the weekend with temperatures falling into the upper teens to mid 20s by Friday night. Assuming temperatures fall into the 20s Tuesday night, there will be no freeze headlines in effect for the following nights.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes, they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above-ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
